title: Genre Lightning Story
flavor: You step into the spotlight and tell a story on the spot. The crowd smells fear and plot twists.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They give you (1) a genre, and (2) a random word you MUST include. Tell a 60–90s story. Table votes Success/Fail.

title: The Dramatic Reading
flavor: You perform a live reading—complete with voices, pauses, and unnecessary eye contact.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They choose a tone (wholesome, horror, romantic, noir, etc.) and a forbidden word you may NOT say. Read/recite for ~60s. Vote.

title: One-Word Chorus Challenge
flavor: You debut a song, but someone heckles a word you HAVE to sing like you meant it.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They give you a random word. Sing 20–40s of an original hook/verse including the word at least once. Vote.

title: Genre Swap Cover
flavor: You cover a famous song… in the wrong genre. On purpose. Allegedly.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They name a well-known song (or simple melody) and a genre/style (opera, reggae, metal, lullaby, etc.). Perform 20–40s. Vote.

title: Style Switch Freestyle
flavor: You dance like your career depends on it—because it does.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They give you a dance style. Dance 20–30s. Halfway through, Prompter yells a SECOND style; you must switch instantly. Vote.

title: Emotion + Prop Routine
flavor: You choreograph a tiny masterpiece using… whatever’s on the table.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They choose (1) an emotion, and (2) a prop/object within reach (phone, napkin, pen, etc.). Dance 20–30s incorporating both. Vote.

title: Cold Read: The Audition
flavor: You get handed a script and zero mercy.
notes: Pick a Reader. They give you 2–3 lines of dialogue (they can invent them). You perform the lines twice: first neutral, then with an emotion the Reader assigns. Vote.

title: Two-Person Improv Scene
flavor: You and a partner build a scene out of nothing but vibes and panic.
notes: Pick a Partner. A third player gives you: (1) location, (2) relationship, (3) a secret objective for YOU only. Improv 45–60s. Vote (everyone).

title: Trailer Pitch in 60 Seconds
flavor: You pitch a trailer so vivid everyone can see the montage in their minds.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They give you a genre + a random object that must appear. Verbally cut a trailer pitch in ~60s (shots, music, taglines). Vote.

title: One-Shot Scene Block
flavor: You direct a one-take scene with imaginary camera moves and real commitment.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They give you a constraint: no dialogue OR only whispers OR must include a reveal. Act out/direct a 30–45s one-shot. Vote.

title: Speed Sketch Prompt
flavor: You make art fast enough to hear your ancestors yelling 'UNDO!'
notes: Pick a Prompter. They give you a prompt (noun + vibe). You have 60s to sketch on paper/phone. Show the group. Vote.

title: Logo Redesign Hot Seat
flavor: A brand needs a new look. You are the brand. Everything is brand.
notes: Pick a Prompter. They name a real or silly brand + 2 keywords (e.g., luxury + chaos). Describe (or sketch) a new logo + color palette in 60–90s. Vote.
